description: From Middle English gainsayen, ȝeinseggen (“to say against, say in opposition to”), equivalent to gain- +‎ say. Compare Old Danish gensige (“to speak against; gainsay”), Swedish gensaga (“a speaking against; protest”).

verbs.description: gainsay (third-person singular simple present gainsays, present participle gainsaying, simple past and past participle gainsaid)

entries.meaning: (transitive, formal) To say something in contradiction to.
examples: Synonyms: controvert, deny, dispute, refute, withsay
